Package io.crums.sldg.db

Interface EntitySerializer<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the entity type
public interface EntitySerializer<T>
Interface for loading an entity (an object of type T) from a standalone file. The methods specified here take only non-null arguments and never return null. I/O errors are raised by UncheckedIOExceptions.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default T load​(java.io.File file)
    Loads and returns the entity from the file by guessing its format from its filename extension.
    default T load​(java.io.File file, Format format)
    Loads and returns the entity from the given file.
    T loadBinary​(java.io.File file)
    Loads the given binary file and return the entity in it.
    T loadJson​(java.io.File file)
    Loads the given JSON file and returns the entity in it.
    default void write​(T entity, java.io.File file, Format format)
    Writes an entity to the specified file in the given format.
    void writeBinary​(T entity, java.io.File file)
    Writes the given entity in binary format to the specified file.
    void writeJson​(T entity, java.io.File file)
    Writes the given entity as JSON to the specified file.

  • Method Details

    • load

      default T load​(java.io.File file)
      Loads and returns the entity from the file by guessing its format from its filename extension. The current convention is that absent a recognized extension, a binary format is assumed. The only recognized file extension is currently .json.
      Parameters:
      file - single-entity file

    • load

      default T load​(java.io.File file, Format format)
      Loads and returns the entity from the given file. This is probably just a pedantic method for closure: doubt it'll be used it much.
      Parameters:
      format - the file format

    • loadJson

      T loadJson​(java.io.File file)
      Loads the given JSON file and returns the entity in it.
      Parameters:
      file - JSON file

    • loadBinary

      T loadBinary​(java.io.File file)
      Loads the given binary file and return the entity in it.
      Parameters:
      file - binary file

    • writeJson

      void writeJson​(T entity, java.io.File file)
      Writes the given entity as JSON to the specified file.

    • writeBinary

      void writeBinary​(T entity, java.io.File file)
      Writes the given entity in binary format to the specified file.

    • write

      default void write​(T entity, java.io.File file, Format format)
      Writes an entity to the specified file in the given format.
